intro: Verbesina monticola, commonly known as mountain beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Verbesina monticola is typically found in dry, open habitats like woodlands and prairies.
